title: Video-Based Mathematics Learning Design for Students with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and ability to use digital devices
context.additional_context: Requires personalized approaches considering individual cognitive traits and learning pace differences, utilizing non-real-time video content under teacher supervision

learning_goals: Learners can solve fraction/decimal operation problems with 80% accuracy through video-based learning materials.
Learners can independently explain problem-solving strategies three or more times via interactive quizzes provided after watching videos.
Learners can access the LMS at least twice weekly, complete video learning materials, and share learning experiences on discussion boards.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
